resources.string: Debug mode allows you to debug sensors used within this application. Specify the sensor you wish to debug, the polling rate of the sensor, and the number of times you wish to poll the sensor. Readings will then be exported into a yml file.

Manual tracking is the simplest type of tracking mode this app offers. Simply select the "Manual Tracking" option by clicking on the MODE button. After pressing the record button, you can then click on the object that you wish to track, every 3-5 seconds. \n\nUpon each click, the coordinates of the touch will be appended to a .yml data file, along with the time and frame number of the touch. A circle will be overlayed on the touch location*. Along with the recording file, the data file allows for offline tracking using your favourite external tools.

Automatic tracking uses a more advanced technique called "template matching". When selecting this method, the user will be presented with an option to select a template of the image that they wish to track. The user can also select a matching method (the default being CCOEFF Normalized). This is explained in the"Matching Methods" selection below. 

 Upon selecting the template and pressing record, template matching uses a method that searches the entire image frame for the template specified by the user. Upon finding a closest match, a bounding box will be drawn around the location of the detected object*. 

To select a template for template matching: 

1) Click the MODE button and select Automatic Tracking (Manual Tracking is default, unless specified in preferences). 
		1.1) Optionally, select a different matching method. Each match methods have their own benefits, explained below. 
 2) Ensure that the object you wish to track is clearly displayed on screen (with no blur). 
 3) Press the Live button to freeze the camera preview. This allows you to select the template with ease, as the object will not move. 
 4) Once the camera preview is frozen, hold your finger and drag a box around the object you wish to track. 
 5) Once you are happy with the selection process, press the Freeze button to restart the camera preview. 
 6) Upon pressing the freeze button, the template will be saved, and automatic tracking will start.


Updating the template: 

To update the template, simply click on the location of the new template. The location that you click on will act as the center point of the new template. Note that the new template will be of identical size to the initial template you selected. 

If the newly selected template is not within range of the screen size, then a notification will appear, notifying the user that manual template correction has failed. It is advised to keep the object you wish to track in the center of the screen, for optimal results.


Cancelling the initialization: 

There may be times where you need to cancel the template initialisation process. For example, if you pressed the "Freeze" button and the resultant frame is blurry, you should cancel the initialization and start again. 
 To cancel the initialization, once the process has started, a "CANCEL INITIALIZATION" button will appear on the top edge of the screen. If you press this, the preview will unfreeze, and you will be given the opportunity to reinitialize the whole process, or switch modes.



*You can change the circle overlay color by tapping the icon labelled "Color". Note that due to limitations of OpenCV4Android, the alpha value can only be changed for manual tracking, and is thus disabled for automatic tracking.

This application allows for 6 different template matching methods when using automatic tracking. Each method has its own benefits, including speed vs accuracy tradeoffs.


CCOEFF 
Description here.


CCOEFF Normed 
This matching method is default, and for good reason. Although this function involves the most computation compared to the other 5 (and is thus slower), the extra computation results in higher accuracy when template matching. On modern Android phones (2015 and above), this matching method performs well, with acceptable FPS. Older phones may experience some noticeable FPS drops.

There are various hardware parameters that determine how well this application will run on your phone. Newer phones benefit from more powerful cameras and CPUs, meaning that the recorded video is more crisp, and automatic tracking is faster to process. However, if you have an older device, you can still benefit from this app.


Increasing Performance 
1) Exit from other applications so that your phone has more free RAM. 
2) Make use of your cameras autofocus before selecting a template for template matching 
3) Make use of the zoom feature to track smaller objects


General Tips 
1) This application is optimised to record in landscape mode, so it is recommended that the user record in landscape whenever possible. 
2) During automatic tracking, it is advised that the phone be kept at the same height during the entire recording. Template matching is not scale-invariant, and changing the height of phone during recording can lead to the objects scale changing. 
3)₀


Potential Problems 
1) If the accelerometer and gyroscope values only report 0 in the YML file, this is suggestive that your phone does not support an accelerometer or gyroscope sensor. 
2) If the template is not found in a large majority of frames during automatic tracking, it is recommended to restart the tracking, with a larger template (by using the zoom feature). This will however decrease the FPS during recording. 
3) If recording does not start, ensure that your camera is not being "locked" by another application - restarting your phone should fix this issue. 
4) Ensure you have sufficient storage before recording (500MB+). The amount of available storage space is reported in the top right corner during recording, and the recording will stop if storage is not sufficient.
